subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Tyson Gay warmed up for the world championships with a comfortable victory in the 100 meters at the London Grand Prix, but Jeremy Wariner had to work for his victory in the 400. Gay, the fastest man in the world this year, won the sprint in 10.02 seconds in a headwind, overcoming a poor start to take the lead at the halfway point. Wariner, the Olympic and world champion, passed his United States teammate LaShawn Merritt in the closing meters to win the 400 in 44.05.
